parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions AUR (Alianța pentru Unirea Românilor), a parliamentary candidate party.  It references a statement made by Simion, presumably the party leader, thus directly linking the content to a specific political entity participating in the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach. The content is not a private message or personal communication; it aims to reach a broad audience through a public platform.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The post's objective is to influence public opinion regarding AUR. By highlighting a controversial statement made by Simion and associating it with the well-known manelist Dani Mocanu's disapproval, the post aims to sway voters' perceptions of AUR, potentially negatively impacting their electoral prospects.  The post uses a public figure's opinion to influence the public's view of a political party, which is a clear attempt to influence the vote.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post presents information, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting.  It focuses on a single, potentially damaging, statement and uses it to create a narrative that could influence voters' choices. It does not present a balanced view or offer alternative perspectives.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the post presents Dani Mocanu's opinion, it is used instrumentally to advance a particular political narrative against AUR. The post itself is not a personal opinion; it's a strategically crafted message aimed at influencing the election.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>362792233522175</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Info360, meets the criteria for electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  It directly refers to AUR, a parliamentary candidate, and aims to influence voters' perceptions of the party by highlighting a controversial statement made by its leader. The post uses a public figure's opinion to achieve this, making it a clear attempt to influence the vote. The fact that it's a paid advertisement on a public platform further strengthens the argument that it's intended for wide dissemination and electoral impact.  While the post presents information, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality of journalistic reporting, instead focusing on a single, potentially damaging, statement to create a narrative that could influence voters' choices.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>AUR</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Info360</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Info360, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 (ID postare: 362792233522175), care face referire directă la AUR, un candidat la alegerile parlamentare, prezentând o declarație controversată a liderului partidului, Simion, și asociind-o cu dezaprobarea manelistului Dani Mocanu, cu scopul clar de a influența negativ percepția publicului asupra AUR și, implicit, votul alegătorilor.  Postarea, prin natura sa publică și plătită, este evident destinată unei diseminări largi și are un efect electoral direct, nefiind o simplă relatare jurnalistică obiectivă.  Conținutul postării, prin manipularea informației și lipsa neutralității, constituie o formă de propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
